website_summaries.verdict: The Marantz SR5009 looks and feels more upscale than the competition's receivers, and follows through with stellar sound quality.
pros: The Marantz SR5009 boasts a lot of different connection options including eight HDMI ports and wireless standards like Airplay and Spotify Connect
It delivers excellent performance on music and is just as capable with movies
There's plenty of sonic power on tap, and surprisingly good Bluetooth performance, despite the lack of aptX support
cons: Somewhat pricey and no dedicated phono input

customer_reviews.title: great a/v reciever
customer_reviews.text: This reciever is a great performer. I am using it to power JBL 400watt 4 ways. Great audio clarity and control. Tight bass and ridiculous highs. At 80% output it performs almost as well as my old Conrad Johnson set up. The video features are awesome. Switching between 4 HDMI sources is handy. The bluetooth streaming is cool. The wifi features are ok but could be better. Needs HD FM. I have not used the surround sound yet. Overall I highly recommend this reciever to anyone who desires both high end audio and video performance in one unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D.

customer_reviews.title: Cool receiver, however it periodically freezes and requires the ...
customer_reviews.text: Cool receiver, however it periodically freezes and requires the power plug to be pulled in order to reset it. None of the buttons on the device or the remote work when it freezes. This has happened three times to me. Other than that though, lots of cool features and works well most of the time. Hopefully a firmware update will fix this down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent home theater device
customer_reviews.text: Excellent home theater device. Easy to install and program. Sounds terrific. Only complaint is the very small display which is comically small. If the display was larger, it would merit 5 stars. Figure 1 hour to set up IF you know what you are doing.
customer_reviews.author: Reasonable Person

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I have only begun to tap into this things potential. But I have it paired with Klipsch speakers for my home theater, and the audio results are outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Rohman

customer_reviews.title: Best Receiver you can get on a budget for a 5.1 setup
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to power a pair of Martin Logan tower speakers, center channel and two in-ceiling MLs as well. Compared to my Denon X2000, I'm hearing sounds I've never heard before. Everything is crisp and clear, and the dialog levels are good. I don't have to fight between listening to the movie soundtrack or trying to understand the dialog. For a 5.1 setup, I'd recommend this above all else. It is worth the premium. To boot it comes with HDMI 2.0 ports, but since I don't have any 4k content I have not tested that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Demetrius Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Can't Network
customer_reviews.text: I tried two of these units and had to return both as they refused to work with my WiFi. I got Marantz tech support on the line and they walked me through everything, had me reset the unit and try again. No luck. My WiFi is not unusual and has a wide variety of devices that work fine with it so it was just something with these units. Seemed like nice units otherwise for the price. Sorry I couldn't keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This avr blew my $4000 integra out of the water at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: T PATTERSON

customer_reviews.title: Best Receiver for the money - probably
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound. It makes my infinity reference series speakers come to life with the room filling warm sound. The difference in movies is noticeable but not as much as with music. For music - marantz is probably one of the very best amps you can buy for the money. The M-DAX feature for sound regeneration of lossy audio works great as well. I would definitely recommend this receiver - even though its actually quite expensive.
customer_reviews.author: LFC

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound! Powerful and excellent sound quality... Easy to set up and with a huge variety of features.
customer_reviews.author: Luis De Leon

customer_reviews.title: ... SR5009 open box from Amazon Warehouse Deals what a waste of a lot of time and energy not to ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Marantz SR5009 open box from Amazon Warehouse Deals what a waste of a lot of time and energy not to mention all the headaches. The unit never worked no sound or video. VERY DISSPOINTED. Called manufacturer they informed me how to reset the unit but still NO output.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: very nice receiver when work
customer_reviews.text: very nice receiver when work. but with out not reason stop working them you have to unplug the power cord to reset the problem and then start working again
customer_reviews.author: Felipe S.

customer_reviews.title: Very sound design and implementation. True to specs.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design and function. Everything i put it thou was A ok. Sound was solid even at the lower output Levels. I hope to see other more detailed reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: It'"s a terrible waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Marantz receiver that's a piece of ____. I guess that I thought the first one was a fluke, but the failure level is consistent. The first one had HDMI total failure and with this one, the Airplay and Bluetooth won't stay connected to the router. It'"s a terrible waste of money, time, and energy. Total crap......
customer_reviews.author: Richard B. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: The red headed stepchild of the range?
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize this when I spent all that money but this model doesn't share all the little benefits of the more pricey models. Marantz man up and fix the issues, we paid enough for the device now support it! Pro's: Really great sound. Negatives: A dedicated but crappy phone app (all the more expensive models get a better app, why?) Airplay fails all the time. Internet radio stops all the time. They never have firmware updates to improve the system
customer_reviews.author: FireFly

customer_reviews.title: WiFi stopped working after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Maranta does not have a repair center in WI. I would have to pay to ship it out of state just to get an estimate for a repair. Tech support would not tell me if the network card is built in on the main board or can be replaced separately. If not separate the the cost of shipping plus parts and labor would be more than a new AV receiver. Spent a lot of money for a three years. Not purchasing Marantz again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this device.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product if you want to use Pandora or AirPlay or Bluetooth connections. The software is worthless. This device is a complete waste of money unless you hard wire directly to your source. Customer service has no idea how to make it work. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sound, easy integration (with Control4 system in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful sound, easy integration (with Control4 system in my case), elegant display and logical software. A very nice A/V receiver for the money. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: ALY

customer_reviews.title: Marantz product support is HORRIBLE. they use second party vendors for all their ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a defective product. Was shipped with a faulty circuit, whenever turned up volume it shorted out. Marantz product support is HORRIBLE. they use second party vendors for all their repairs and you have to pay to ship receiver back to them (around $50) for a product that NEVER WORKED. Never buy their products
customer_reviews.author: June Harnish

customer_reviews.title: It's a great amplifier in terms of sound quality but has alot ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my SR5009 in the end of October. It's a great amplifier in terms of sound quality but has alot of problems processing video. It can't manage the video between my Sony Blu Ray Player and Sony 4k TV. I had to eventually bypass the receiver. Now the network GUI has failed and won't display on the TV. Only solution is to send a brand new unit into Marantz service center to have it repaired. I would avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

product_meta.title: Marantz SR5009 7.2 Network Home Theater A/V Receiver
product_meta.description: Style:ReceiverFeaturing the latest high resolution audio decoders such as Dolby TrueHD and DTS HD Master Audio, the Marantz SR5009 7.2 Network Home Theater A/V Receiver also includes Dolby Pro Logic IIz decoding so you can connect front height speakers for a dramatically expanded front soundstage. Enjoy a whole new world of music listening via your home network with your choice of thousands of internet radio stations available from subscription streaming services including Sirius XM, Spotify, Pandora, Deezer and QQ music (subscriptions required).
feature_bullets: 7.2 channel platform100W(8ohm, 20Hz 20kHz,THD:0.08 percent) Power Amp4K/60Hz full rate pass through Analog to HDMI conversion
Build in Wi Fi and Bluetooth Networking: AirPlay, Android push playback, Internet Radio, Pandora(U) , Spotify Connect, Deezer (N to be upgrade), QQ(K),Sirius XM(U), DSD play back, DLNA 1.5
Audyssey Mult EQ XT setup with MIC stand included in the box / Dynamic EQ & Volume Dolby PlL2z"
HDMI : Front 1in , Rear 7in/2 dual out Digital audio inputs :2 Opt /2 Coax Audio: 5in, Video: CVBS 3in / 1out, Component 2in / 1outFront panel USB input with iPod digital direct
AM/FM Radio2 zone/2 source via variable pre outs and Amplified zone Remote in/out, RS232C, C4 SDDPisf Calibration Inlet type detachable AC cable
